summary: Email correspondence regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's quarantine at MDC Brooklyn after exposure to a COVID-positive staff member. The emails discuss the quarantine's impact on her legal access, including calls, visits, and discovery review.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the emails; she is an inmate at MDC Brooklyn (register number 02879-509) who has been placed in quarantine due to COVID-19 exposure.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell; she is inquiring about the quarantine's impact on legal calls, visits, and discovery access for her client.

events.title: Maxwell COVID-19 Test and Quarantine Initiation
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell received a nasal swab test and was placed in quarantine/SHU after close contact with a COVID-positive staff member.

events.title: Quarantine Status Communication
events.description: Email correspondence confirms Maxwell is in quarantine for approximately 14 days, impacting her legal visit schedule but allowing continued legal calls and discovery review.

locations: New York, NY 10011 (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was placed in quarantine at MDC Brooklyn after close contact with a staff member who tested positive for COVID-19.
Maxwell tested negative for COVID-19 but was to remain in quarantine for approximately 14 days with testing protocols.
Her quarantine status canceled in-person legal visits but allowed her to continue with 3 hours of legal calls per day and access to electronic discovery.
The correspondence highlights operational challenges and legal access issues in the federal prison system during the COVID-19 pandemic.
